profiles:
Experience Founder & Director Asia Arising July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Palo Alto, CA • Direct a faith-based community initiative to serve underprivileged communities in Cambodia. 
• Lead videoconference business meetings with Cambodian staff.  
• Lead business meetings with local volunteers.  
• Provide strategic counsel on all projects. 
 Senior Administrative Associate Stanford University March 2015  – Present (6 months) Residential & Dining Enterprises - Central Operations • Senior Administrative Associate to the Senior Associate Vice Provost for R&DE 
• Coordinate the executive's activities  
• Organize and maintain the workings of the executive's office. 
• Plan and coordinate logistics for meetings and conferences. 
• Serve as the executive's liaison. 
• Oversee and manage multiple projects 
• Direct staff to perform various tasks and assignments. Country Director Jordan International Aid 2012  –  2014  (2 years) Siem Reap, Cambodia • Initiated communication and held ongoing meetings with the Provincial Minister of Education and the National Deputy Minister of Education over a period of 18 months to fulfill the procedural requirements that resulted in successfully obtaining a Memorandum of Understanding between JIA and the Royal Government of Cambodia.  
• Writing and Editing Skills: Drafted and submitted necessary documentation including the JIA project plan and operating budget to the Provincial and National Ministries of Education. 
• Logistics Management: Coordinated the field logistics for all JIA humanitarian and medical missions in Cambodia. Surveyed and selected appropriate outreach sites; negotiated accommodations, dining, transportation and translation services for visiting teams.  
• Project Management: Coordinated the restoration of a public primary school in a remote floating village in Battambang Province; negotiated and approved estimates from contractors; supervised ongoing work until completion of project. 
 Missionary Apostolic Assembly 2012  –  2014  (2 years) Siem Reap, Cambodia • Project Implementation and Management: Formulated and continually refined the vision and strategic components for AA’s efforts in Cambodia. Implemented the strategy and founded a faith-based congregation in Siem Reap City that serves the underprivileged community. Founded and directed a Missionary Training Center (MTC); developed a teaching curriculum and training program.  
• Personnel Recruitment and Development: Recruited, coached, supervised and evaluated staff members including an administrator, teachers, home group leaders and village outreach teams. Trained a succeeding Cambodian staff who continue to give guidance and education to over 300 congregants. Trained succeeding co-directors for the MTC who continue to lead and expand the center. 
• Relationship Cultivation Skills: Built and maintained relationships and partnerships across cultural and language boundaries with diverse audiences ranging from village farmers and fishermen to professionals and government officials. 
• External Partnerships: Partnered with local non-government organizations (NGOs) that rescued young ladies from the sex industry. The NGOs provided psychological and emotional rehabilitation; AA received the young ladies into its congregation and provided social and spiritual rehabilitation. 
•	Financial Management: Fiscal responsibilities included budget development and implementation, authorizing and monitoring expenditures, and income and expense reporting. 
•	Resource Development: Identified and recruited donors including individuals, faith-based groups and private businesses. Maintained donors informed about the progress of ongoing projects and usage of funds. 
•	Technical Responsibilities: Developed and maintained a fund raising website/blog; published ongoing newsletters; disseminated information through social media platforms. 
 Founder & Pastor Mount Zion Apostolic Church 2004  –  2010  (6 years) Mount Kisco, New York • Project Implementation and Management: Founded and developed a Spanish-speaking congregation in suburban New York City that served the Central American immigrant community. 
• Staff Development and Evaluation: Recruited, trained, organized and directed staff including three ordained ministers, secretary, treasurer and five department coordinators. Developed job descriptions for volunteer staff members in various departments. Provided ongoing coaching and evaluation. 
• Public Speaking: Prepared and presented sermons, homilies, leadership conferences and staff training seminars. 
• Financial Management: Budget development, implementation and ongoing review. 
 Operations Manager Apostolic Assembly International Headquarters 2001  –  2004  (3 years) Rancho Cucamonga, California • Operations Management: Oversaw, assessed and improved daily operations and managed the facilities. 
• Communication Skills: Functioned as the first point of contact on behalf of the AAIQ for all facilities, telecommunications and shipping vendors.  
• Supervisorial Responsibilities: Supervised a team of four managers and eleven support employees in performing diverse departmental functions. 
• Human Resource Management: Directed human resource functions including recruiting, interviewing, hiring, orientation, performance review, recognition programs, compensation, discipline and termination.  
• Analytical Skills: Continually reviewed office systems in order to increase efficiency and effectiveness. 
• Event Planning: Coordinated the semi-annual joint meetings between the Board of Directors and Episcopal Body. Negotiated accommodations, meeting facilities, multimedia and dining services. 
• Executive Assistance: Provided diversified administrative support to both the President (P) and Vice-president (VP). Represented and spoke on behalf of the office P & VP to a variety of internal and external officials while exhibiting a high level of diplomacy and tact. 
• Organizational Skills: Kept P & VP informed of all matters requiring attention and provided a timely flow of information necessary for making decisions. Independently screened and prioritized correspondence and telephone calls; managed contacts and schedules; tracked critical dates and anticipated needs.  
• Research, Writing and Editing: Compiled information and created and edited presentations. Researched, drafted and submitted proposals and reports to the Board of Directors as needed. Composed, proofread and finalized correspondence and documents.  Executive Assistant Apostolic Assembly International Headquarters 2000  –  2001  (1 year) Rancho Cucamonga, California • Organizational Skills: Provided the General Secretary with a full array of administrative support. Organized calendar and contacts; screened correspondence and telephone calls; oversaw filing systems for retention of supporting materials; processed ministerial credentials; processed corporate resolution requests and drafted approved resolutions.  
• Communication Skills: Interacted with a variety of internal constituents including bishops and pastors and external agencies including business professionals, attorneys and bank representatives through both oral and written communication. Founder & Director Asia Arising July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Palo Alto, CA • Direct a faith-based community initiative to serve underprivileged communities in Cambodia. 
• Lead videoconference business meetings with Cambodian staff.  
• Lead business meetings with local volunteers.  
• Provide strategic counsel on all projects.

Senior Administrative Associate Stanford University School of Medicine March 2006  –  December 2008  (2 years 10 months) Managed calendar for Geoffrey C. Gurtner MD, Peter Lorenz MD; arranged domestic and international travel and expenses; scheduled meetings and teleconferences..  
Strong problem-solving and interpersonal skills in communication with all level of employ.  
Provided administrative support; maintained Vitas, phone lists, and synchronize the doctor’s personal digital assistant and and ordered meeting appropriate catering.  
Budgeted, forecasted, monitored and reconciled multi-departmental expenses on a monthly. Ordered supplies according to budget plan; tracked and controlled grants in the department, purchase orders, invoices, and payment request paperwork; updated our webpage. Executive Administrative Assistant to Chief Technology Officer HPSHOPPING.COM November 2000  –  March 2006  (5 years 5 months) Managed calendars; arranged domestic and international travel and expenses for Chief Technology Officer. Set up meeting and teleconferences. Generated, reviewed correspondence and power point slide presentations. 
Provided administrative support for Technology, Store Operations and Sales Call Center staff totaling 180 employees. Scheduled meetings and teleconferences domestic and international, generate meeting minutes, and orders catering. Maintained phone lists, telephone distribution lists and public distribution lists in Outlook.  
Event planning: Creatively planned events and budgets for holiday parties and employee functions, to be reviewed and approved by CEO and CFO. . 
Allocated office and cube space for regular and contract employees; set up office computers and phones, as well as cell phones and pagers. Maintain network printers, copiers and fax machines.  
Budgeted, monitored and reconciled departmental expenses on a monthly basis. Order supplies according to budget plan. 
International travel: Assisted with visa applications; airfare, lodging and meeting logistics; arranged conferences in foreign countries without actually going to the specific country. Receptionist/ Administrative Assistant Olympian May 1996  –  November 2000  (4 years 7 months) Telephone support analyst; routed incoming telephone calls to the staff of 300, maintained employee contact directory. Utilized walkie- talkie phone system to monitor and communicate with remote employees. 
Maintained log of all incoming deliveries, and dispatched after-hours maintenance and card personnel. 
Processed paperwork for accounting and purchasing, including invoicing; researched missing purchase orders.  
Beta tester for development of hazardous material software, required for compliance with federal laws. 
Updated Map and Service guide database with new gas station locations for use by company answering service. Helped customers and truckers locate fueling stations across the country.
